website_summaries.verdict: The tube can be frustrating but the conditioner works well – provided you don't mind the small portion that may not last very long.
pros: Formulated with all-natural and organic plant-based ingredients, including palm oil, which stand up to high temperatures
Users brag about the nice finish it produces, even on old, damaged cast iron pieces
cons: Difficult to get out of the tube
Somewhat pricey, as you only get 6 ounces and should use it generously to get the best results

customer_reviews.title: Better design is called for.
customer_reviews.text: Here's the thing, I live in FL where it is not unusual for our home to hit 76 degrees. At that temperature it runs out of the tube like water. At 66 degrees it hardens to where you need good force to squeeze it out. Obviously, the problem is not the oil, but the container. It should be adjustable so you can control the flow. Also, the lid seal doesn't do a great job. I've had to clean the oil off the counter that leaked out. Besides these annoyances it's not a bad product for keeping your pan seasoned.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I Am So Glad I Bought This
customer_reviews.text: I treat my cast iron skillets like my babies, I try to really take care of them. prior to getting this conditioner, I'd season my pans with coconut oil after each use but they were never totally non-stick. After the first use of this conditioner the first thing I noticed was that it seemed to absorb into the iron. The next thing I noticed is that food was no longer sticking to my pots. Great product and one I will never be without.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spence

customer_reviews.title: The conditioner is great. My pans look great and it feels great ...
customer_reviews.text: The conditioner is great. My pans look great and it feels great on my hands too. Will buy it again. The tube container is absolutely awful. First time I tried to use it the stuff wouldn'ct come out. I squeezed harder and the back end exploded out and I had the stuff everywhere. I ended up putting all of it in a glass jar that used to hold dry yeast. Perfect size and made it much easier to use. They need to change the container.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Grant

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for seasoning and maintaining your cast iron and steel appliances
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a new 22-inch gas griddle that required seasoning before it could be used for cooking. I have used this product for my cast iron pans for years and decided to use it instead of following the manufacturer's suggestion. I baked off the pre-seasoning in the oven, applied the Camp Chef seasoning and placed the griddle into a 450 degree oven for 45 minutes. I repeated this a couple of times and the griddle, as pictured, is now dark,smooth and ready for grilling season. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F. Moore

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: My husband used my two cast iron dutch ovens to make corned beef, but neglected to wash out the pots afterward. Needless to say, when I discovered the ruination of the years of seasoning destroyed by the salt brine, I wanted to cry. This product is so much better than using vegetable oil or shortening as I have done in the past. It seals the surfaces well and does not leave a sticky residue. Hope it gets back to at least an approximation of the old coating. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: MV Trish

customer_reviews.title: A cast-iron essential
customer_reviews.text: definitely worth purchasing if you have any cast-iron products. A bit of advice when you get this is to "squish" it around inside of the bottle, as it probably has been sitting for a while, and the oils have all congealed. Squishing (for lack of a better word) will re-liquify this product, allowing it to be spread more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have really been enjoying the way my cast iron looks and feels using this product. Even my old reliable cast iron looks great. I have been reclaiming some very neglected family cast iron and this is the best I have found to bring back the seasoning to a usable level. What I appreciate most is that when you are finished seasoning the item, it is not sticky. With other oils or lard, you have a sticky residue that is just not as nice to use. I highly recommend this for anyone wanting to use their cast iron again, or for the new cast iron owner.
customer_reviews.author: Percheron

customer_reviews.title: Great conditioner and a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great conditioner and a good price. I use cast iron skillets almost daily and after I wash these I dry them and apply this with a paper towel to the pan. It makes my pans look new. You should not put up your cast iron without using this product! I've been using it for about six years.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Mae

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRODUCT AVAILABLE
customer_reviews.text: ALL I USE FOR COOKING IS CAST IRON. FRY PANS (ONE IS OVER 100 YEARS OLD, MY GRANDMOTHERS) THE REST I PURCHASED ON MY OWN. ABOUT 25 PIECES. THIS PRODUCT KEEPS THE SEASONING IN TACT, PREVENTS RUST AND KEEPS THE PIECES READY FOR USE, NO MATTER HOW LONG THEY SIT UNUSED. EASY TO USE. BEST PRODUCT AVAILABLE. BUY SOME, USE IT AND YOU'LL BUY MORE.
customer_reviews.author: john birkenheier

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Ho Hum
customer_reviews.text: This is not an overly impressive product. There are a lot of inexpensive oils on the market that do as well as this product. It does blacken you pans between uses but I can't see that it does much for the seasoning. I did not have the hard tube problem that so many find problematic. I doubt I would buy the product again but I wouldn't tell anyone not to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: LTB

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using flaxseed oil capsules and cut the tip off 3-4 of them and rubbed it on the cast iron skillets. I always felt about 10% of it was wasted because I couldn't squeeze the last bit out of the capsule. With this, I know that I get 100% of what I squeeze out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Really not impressed. I am not sure what the reviews are about it being thick. It is like a runny liquid even in a house that is cold. Have to store it upright or it leaks. Nothing special, there are much better options, Crisbee is much better.
customer_reviews.author: JTD19971

customer_reviews.title: Good product but hard to squeeze from the tube
customer_reviews.text: The cast iron conditioner does its job, but it is a little too thick and hard to squeeze from the tube. It is not the ideal situation if you have arthritic hands. I would like the product much better if it came in a jar instead of a tube.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.text: works good, i plan to buy this again. *** i have been using this stuff for nearly two weeks now, it works great. it has caused a lot of extra work because i have stripped my skillets down to bare metal and seasoned each one . makes a nice black sheen , easy to work with. the cookware looks like it should. my old grannies would have been proud of me.
customer_reviews.author: wayne matteson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This works wonderfully for conditioning my cast irons after each use. No yucky tasting residue. The only thing I don't like about it is it's hard to use when cold but that's to be expected because of the ingredients, one of which is coconut oil which solidifies when cold.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mille-Long

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easiest to use when reconditioning cast iron cookware. also use as cover oil before storing pans in cupboard, just wipe off excess before using pan. oil doesn't get sticky like cooking oil does after a few weeks of storage
customer_reviews.author: debbie lane

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my cast iron pans. Keeps them from rusting and makes them non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Kahrens

customer_reviews.title: Conditions my cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to use. Not too oily/greasy. Clogged up after a while and takes a real good squeeze to come out. May be due to some separation of the oils/grease that it uses.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great for all cast iron cookware!
customer_reviews.text: Great conditioner for your cast iron cookware. My normal procedure after cooking with cast iron, is to run it under hot water (don't use soap when washing cast iron), scrub with a chain cleaner (found here in amazon), then dry with a paper towel. After the cookware is dry, I use this conditioner sparingly, and apply with a clean paper towel. Rub it all over the cookware, then store in a cool, dry place.
customer_reviews.author: heychubs

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cast iron rust free...
customer_reviews.text: The first order arrived and the tube had leaked all inside the box. The package was not damaged but the tube did leak. I don't think it was anybody's fault but the Florida sun. It has been very hot here and I think the heat expanded the oils inside the tube causing it to leak. I placed a damaged product report at Amazon and a new tube was immediately replaced. Excellent product, excellent customer service. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MooseyCat

customer_reviews.title: Incredible stuff
customer_reviews.text: I had a love hate relationship with my cast iron until I bought this, and I regularly give it as a wedding gift with a cast iron pan. Eggs slide around on my skillet like it’s nonstick, and it makes treating it foolproof.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Joy

customer_reviews.title: Cement in a bottle
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff I think. Hard to tell. Squeeze the bottle till you’re eyes pop out. My cast iron is dirty still out of sheer eye self-preservation. 👀 (what is this made of?! Lotion/cement?!)
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great for reconditioning old cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: Re-conditioned my cast iron with this by scrubbing off old gunk with mild detergent, conditioning with this product (wipe off excess) then baking for 1hr at 500F. Restored the patina on my cast iron cookware nicely without leaving a sticky residue.
customer_reviews.author: Spatial_k

customer_reviews.title: Can be tough to squeeze out of tube, paste like consistency gets hardened up
customer_reviews.text: Has paste like consistency which seems to harden up to the point that I couldn't squeeze it out of the tube. You have to work the tube by squeezing it to mix it up to get it flowing sometimes. Once out of the tube it is easier to spread a thin layer over the pan with a paper towels, better if the pan is warmed up a bit. Seems to be working well for seasoning the pan, but I cant tell if it is actually better than normal oil or not
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a cast iron grill for a while and this is working well for me. The burnt stuff comes right off with a scraper with expected effort and after a scrub and dry, this is put on while still warm and stored when cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Wing Duck

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cast iron shiny
customer_reviews.text: I apply the conditioner after washing my cast iron skillet with warm soapy water and heating it on the stove until it is warm. Applying just a small amount was able to coat my 8in skillet. I agree with another reviewer that in warmer weather it can get very runny when and can spill all over the kitchen counter if you are not careful. I still love the product and will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great product ( keep an eye on the price )
customer_reviews.text: I love this conditioner! I use it every time I cook with my cast iron. Some reviews have said that the conditioner is inconsistent which is true some tubes are a nice and smooth paste, some are chunky and hard to get out, but aside from that its a wonderful product. But keep an eye on the price it fluctuates I have seen it go down to $4.75. buy at this price. I do not feel it is worth the $9 it goes up to.
customer_reviews.author: YEE YEE

customer_reviews.title: Applied 4 layers on my unseasoned (had to remove crappy seasoning from Lodge) pot at start
customer_reviews.text: Applied 4 layers on my unseasoned (had to remove crappy seasoning from Lodge) pot at start. Applying another layer after every 4-6 uses since. worked great, no problems and I'm not the most careful user occasionally leaving pot in water for 30-40 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: igordin

customer_reviews.title: Like that this stuff can't go rancid on you like cooking oils
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge cast iron fan, and I know that it is important to keep my cast iron well seasoned. When I season a new pan or re-season a favorite, I use methods that are easily found online--involving multiple "cooking" of the pans in my oven. But when I'm on the road (we use cast iron in our motorhome), I use the Camp Chef conditioner inbetween major re-seasoning... It's great because it is easy to store and to use, and this product will not go rancid if stored for extended periods of time. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Yes you can just use oil, but why? This conditioner is so nice! And the price is great. A bottle lasts us quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Instant cast iron seasoning
customer_reviews.text: Instantly seasons your cast iron cookware. I feel free now to be bad and scrub my iron frying pan with detergent, which is a no-no, because I can then dry it, apply this, and it's gorgeous and good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Arlington Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We use this all the time for our griddles. This is a easy wayto purchase for a great price, and shipped to home
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: The Best CI Seasoning
customer_reviews.text: I have three skillets and one flat griddle; I use Camp Chef seasoning on all of them. Before I learned of this product, I used Crisco to do the seasoning. Not any more! I have to say the this is the best seasoning for me, and it far outperforms Crisco. The CI blackens right up and it only takes about three cycles through the oven to get it done. Then every once in awhile a touch-up. Fantastic stuff, and I'm glad I found it. I would definitely recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: I use it to maintain the seasoning of my cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I used this to renew the seasoning on my cast iron cookware. I like the fact that the ingredients are all natural. Basically consists of organic palm oil, coconut oil and sunflower seed oil. It also has vitamin e and citric acid as well. After wiping out my cookware and getting it clean I just warm it to open the pores and then wipe the cast iron conditioner on it and let it cool. It's a great way to maintain the season on your pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this product for years and was very happy to find it available on Amazon. Fast shipping and as described. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Keeps pans nice, easy to clean . Product solidifys in the tube when cold making it hard to squeeze out. Best used indoors (warm) still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The stuff was so hard to get out of the tube....that the tube cracked in several places. Pretty much worthless
customer_reviews.author: drumwraith

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff for cast iron. Gives it a good seal and coating and makes my pans almost as easy as non stick cookware.
customer_reviews.author: M. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Works as hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Has a high smoke-point which is very important in my use of it to season my cast-iron skillet. It is providing a better seasoning layer (and providing a dark sheen) that a different seasoning oil I used prior to this.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Used this product and love it
customer_reviews.text: This was hard to find in stores so I loved it could be delivered to my door. We've used it many times and it's great at keeping your cast iron looking new.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Great Cast Iron Conditioner
customer_reviews.text: We use this cast iron conditioner every time we clean the pan and it keeps it seasoned and nonstick. In colder weather (or if you keep on a windows sill by your sink) the product thickens up and is harder to squeeze out of the package. A quick run under hot water fixes this issue easily!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, only issue I have is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, only issue I have is the consistency of the liquid is highly dependant on the ambient temperature of the room- so it's a struggle for me to use in the winter as it VERY thick and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have a cast iron 10 inch pan & this stuff works great!
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use it now on every time i wash my cast iron and it keeps them looking great.
customer_reviews.author: jewelz

customer_reviews.title: It works real good. Just be careful using it because it comes ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this quite a few times and haven't had a sticky pan from it yet. It works real good. Just be careful using it because it comes out of the tube like water! A little will go a long way. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn R. Couch

customer_reviews.title: That it does not last long
customer_reviews.text: To season my cast iron pans. It did not last long, before food started sticking again.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: CAST IRON COOKWARE CONDITIONER
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS !!! If you own any cast iron any at all then you will need a tube or two. This cast iron conditioner works on old or new cast iron cookware. I use this mainly for long term storage. Just make sure you wipe it down with a paper towel real good until the cast iron is almost dry. If you leave to much on the cast iron it will become sticky. I have hundreds of cast iron pots, pans, bowls, skillets, lids and Dutch ovens. Yes, reversible large and small grill/griddles too. Be sure to buy a tube or two of this cast iron conditioner it is your cast iron cookware's best friend. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: LJC0867

customer_reviews.title: Keep your cast iron cookware in good shape
customer_reviews.text: This conditioner helps keep our cast iron cookware seasoned. Very easy to use and the tube has a lot in it.
customer_reviews.author: SooZQ

customer_reviews.title: I use it and it does a wonderful job.
customer_reviews.text: My pans are very well seasoned after using this. They don't stick when cooking, and are a breeze to clean. Sometimes the substance is thick and sometimes runny. I don't really care, I use it and it does a wonderful job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maintains Cast Iron cookware
customer_reviews.text: As a born-and-bred Southerner, I live by my heirloom cast iron skillets and pots. After each use, I dry them thoroughly and rub in a squirt of this. About every third or fourth use, I put some of this on the bottoms and handles. I have given this to my daughter and my brother to maintain their cast iron also.
customer_reviews.author: Bettie

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. I would purchase from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Hubby uses our cast iron skillet the majority of the time, have to keep it in good shape.
customer_reviews.text: My cast iron skillet looks better after one use. I never let it sit in water and always oil it after drying thoroughly. But it was improved after the use of this product.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Get the chain mail scrubber and the Camp Chef cleaner to go with the conditioner and you ovens will look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: First time using it. It does leave a residue, which I guess is normal.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Nispiros

customer_reviews.title: Good until it stiffens in like two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Good until it stiffens in like two weeks. It's so stiff that I cannot squeeze anything out of it. I might just have to cut it open and put it in some container and use it. Also don't see much difference between just putting on regular veggie oil or coconut oil.
customer_reviews.author: N. Kim

customer_reviews.title: No complaints with the seasoning quality - just hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: No complaints with the seasoning quality - just hard to use outdoors if the temperature drops. Last camping trip was in the 50s and the conditioner congealed, making it almost impossible to get out of the bottle. Would prefer a wide mouth opening to scoop the stuff into my pans.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Legitimately the worst product I could imagine. It doesn't come out of the squeeze tube at all. I'm stuck now with a cast iron skillet I washed thinking I would use this awful product on.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great conditioner for your cast iron. I bought the cleaner and conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Marie

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time recently. It works very well making a better seasoning than veg oil. To solve the problem of squeezing it out of the tube when it is cold, I set the tube in a glass of hot tap water for a bit, then shook up the contents. It comes out well mixed and easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Must have for all cast iron skillets. After using the same rag a dozen times I don’t even have to use but a small dab to season my skillet. Haven’t used soap on mine for over 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Edward Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: HARD AS A ROCK
customer_reviews.text: Product must have been old. Would not squeeze out of tube. Lumpy and hard.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Buell

customer_reviews.title: regular oil works just fine. Also
customer_reviews.text: Just save your money, regular oil works just fine. Also, the container leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Great product but will need to transfer to a jar b/c you can't get this out of the tube!
customer_reviews.text: This product works well on my cast iron skillets. However, it is impossible to get this stuff out of the tube! I have purchased this product a few times now and upon receiving it, I cut open the tube and transfer the contents into a half-pint size canning jar.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Stebbens

customer_reviews.title: Runny but works well
customer_reviews.text: No odor. Works well. Seems runny so I have no issues spreading the product on to the cast iron skillet, but that could be b/c it's summer time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my skillet ready for use
customer_reviews.text: I use this stuff on my cast iron skillet nearly every day after frying eggs for breakfast. Generally, I just wipe out the skillet with a dry cloth, but a few drops of the case iron conditioner in it and wipe them around. Skillet looks like new and is ready for the next use.
customer_reviews.author: Spicey

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your cast irons.
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly well. Every cast iron pan/item I acquire, gets a full scrubbing and a few layers Camp Chef conditioner. This turns my pans nice and black and gives me such a wonderful nonstick surface. I wouldn't use anything else but this.
customer_reviews.author: Random collections

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I guess. I had been using coconut oil and thought I'd give this a try. I'm not a big fan. It's ok, and I'll use the rest up, but it's not as good as coconut oil.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: Put a coating of this on my lodge cast iron cookware. It does a good job of seasoning the skillet and keeping food from sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Trakbak

customer_reviews.title: camp chef for cast irons
customer_reviews.text: a must have if you have any cast iron pans to clean and season. I only buy camp chef to protect my cookware.
customer_reviews.author: luvher74

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cast iron dutch oven in order to season it.... AMAZING! NOTE: The seasoning (of the dutch oven or cast iron skillet) requires you to coat the inside cooking surface turn upside down and place over heat (or in your oven).... IT WILL STINK!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The only product you’ll need for your cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Does exactly what it says it will do. Every time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Callihan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for maintaining cast iron..I use it along with the cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: It does what suppose to do!
customer_reviews.text: Love my cast irons I use them home and camping this keeps them from rusting and working nice!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Flaxseed to season...Camp Chef to condition
customer_reviews.text: I tried to season my 30 yr old lodge skillets with this and had horrible results. The skillets always seemed dirty leaving black residue when wiped with a clean cloth or paper towel. After much research I finally bought organic flaxseed oil and had night and day results. I do still use this product to thinly coat after washing and drying since flaxseed is not intended to cook with and the coconut oil does not go rancid. Overall this is a true conditioner just not good for seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works well. I clean my cast iron ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works well. I clean my cast iron when it is hot by running hot water over it and sanitizing it with soap. While it is still slightly warm I use this conditioner and leave it on to dry. It does help the pans retain their non-stick properties.
customer_reviews.author: JDW

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great, other cheaper products available
customer_reviews.text: If you have lots of cast iron this can be a good addition for maintaining the items. Some oil works very similar to this but I think this can be a good tool in the arsenal to keep cast iron at its peak.
customer_reviews.author: B-Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Found this product thru an online video for seasoning a skillet. Have tried Crisco. This works much better. Quit being cheap and buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Speed Racer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my Dutch oven and it gave it a great finish
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: when it arrived it was cold and very hard to squeeze out of the tube, so I nuked it in the microwave for a few seconds. I like that it has organic oil ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Amazin Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, non-stick results
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd know about this product as the results are phenominal. Makes my cast iron pans act as though they're non-stick pans. Will never be w/o this!
customer_reviews.author: Robin S.

customer_reviews.title: Works!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a an old dutch oven that seemed rusted beyond repair. After stripping it down I seasoned it with Camp Chef and it's almost as if it's brand new!
customer_reviews.author: David Hopwood

customer_reviews.title: but this makes it so easy and they really do look beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This has given new life and luster to my cast iron pans. I suppose you could make due with other oils around the house, but this makes it so easy and they really do look beautiful. Just follow the simple directions.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Product works really well
customer_reviews.text: I have two old cast iron pans that I wasn't taking very good care of. This rejuvenated them and I'm doing a better job of maintaining my pans with this product.
customer_reviews.author: June Schwierjohn

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron pans got you down?
customer_reviews.text: I cant keep my cast iron free from rust so this is perfect for my pots and pans. Loved it! I have a dutch oven a dutch oven pot and pan combo and a skillet which all needed to be reseasoned. The Cast Iron conditioner was just what our camp kitchen needed.
customer_reviews.author: Celena Spychalla

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works great! I have already re-seasoned 2 cast iron skillets ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! I have already re-seasoned 2 cast iron skillets with it and now the cornbread just falls out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie L Hartgrove

customer_reviews.title: Will improve the appearance of your cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: This product restored our 4 year old gas cooktop cast iron to a better than new look. This will be a permanent product in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Kent R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: This product seems to work best after using the Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: After cleaning the iron cookware with the companion "Cleaner" product, applying a little of this "Conditioner" leaves a thin layer of the right kind of oils to preserve and enhance the seasoned surface of the pan. The cleaner and conditioner make cooking with my iron skillet a non-stick experience. This product seems to work best after using the Cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Washington

customer_reviews.title: Makes seasoning and cleaning cast iron a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my cast iron pans .I was surprised at how small the tube was.I think it is a little pricey
customer_reviews.author: Psych RN

customer_reviews.title: a little dab will do ya
customer_reviews.text: is actually a tube not a bottle...but is the absolute easiest way to condition cast iron pans.
customer_reviews.author: WindyWu

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stuff ! I'd been using Crisco to coat my pans after cleaning but the Camp Chef Conditioner does a better job. It gives the pans a nice, dark luster that lasts. After cleaning, I dry my cast iron, heat it on the stove top to get all the moisture out, then apply a small amount of the conditioner. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is rather difficult to get out of the tube. I usually run hot water over it to soften it up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Yount

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a hard time in the past keeping my cast iron skillets conditioned, but this product does the job well and keeps my skillet in tip- top shape. Wish I'd found it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Love it...the best
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Been using it for years. It is the best for cast iron cookware. Easy to use, squirt, wipe, heat to almost smoking, let cool, put away.
customer_reviews.author: teal blue eyes

customer_reviews.title: Just apply a little over the entire pan (both sides) ...
customer_reviews.text: Just apply a little over the entire pan (both sides) and bake in your grill at around 350 for 1 hour. This mixture of oils produces a dark patina on the first try
customer_reviews.author: Edward G. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i love this stuff !! A must have for any one who owns anything cast iron!!1
customer_reviews.author: Kennard Smith

customer_reviews.title: My things clean up very well and look nice.
customer_reviews.text: This product protects my iron skillet and dutch oven. My things clean up very well and look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Leaky.
customer_reviews.text: I wish this bottle was different. I wish it was a top squirt vs. the way it is. This way it kind of gets super messy and leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Cepower

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed! Save your money and do it the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed! Save your money and do it the old-school way !
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: The Bomb for curing and maintaining Cast Iron!!!
customer_reviews.text: ...Can't beat it....!! I do all my curing outside at 425 degrees!!! Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: bernard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: been using this to season my pans, it seams to be easier to use and doesn't get sticky like veggie oil get sometimes. Good stuff
customer_reviews.author: Mario D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So useful. Better than the coconut oil I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Soooo many amazon boxes

product_meta.title: Cast Iron Conditioner
feature_bullets: Designed especially for use with cast iron
Conditioner is palm oil based formula to season your cast iron
